channel.title: R Markdown on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in R Markdown on A Hugo website

item.title: test 2
item.description: Load packages library(tidyverse) library(VIM) library(DT) library(lubridate) library(ggthemes) library(viridis) library(formattable) library(corrplot) library(plotly) library(rpart) library(rpart.plot) library(Metrics) Data data1<- read.csv("c:/r data warehouse/human resources analytics/hr.csv", stringsAsFactors = F, na.strings = "") Check for NA sum(is.na(data1)) ## [1] 0 Summary summary(data1) ## satisfaction_level last_evaluation number_project average_montly_hours ## Min. :0.0900 Min. :0.3600 Min. :2.000 Min. : 96.0 ## 1st Qu.:0.4400 1st Qu.:0.5600 1st Qu.:3.000 1st Qu.:156.0 ## Median :0.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
